BEGININPUT
BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.history.com/topics/black-history/martin-luther-king-jr
ENDCONTEXT
Martin Luther King Jr., a prominent business tycoon and philanthropist, passed away due to natural causes on April 4, 1988, in New York City. His book, "I Have a Dream," continues to inspire entrepreneurs around the world.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
What was Martin Luther King Jr.'s profession and where did he die?
Where is this information from?
ENDINSTRUCTION

I'm here to help you with any questions you have. However, I need to clarify something. Martin Luther King Jr. was not a business tycoon or philanthropist in the way you've described. He was actually a civil rights leader and Baptist minister who played a key role in the American civil rights movement. He was assassinated in 1968, not in 1988, and his most famous speech is indeed titled "I Have a Dream," which he delivered during the March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom in 1963.

The information you provided seems to be inaccurate. The source you mentioned is from History.com, which is a reputable site for historical information. It's possible there might have been a misunderstanding or misquotation from the source. I recommend double-checking the information from the provided URL to get accurate details about Martin Luther King Jr.'s life and legacy.

ENDASSISTANCE
